title: Israelis, Palestinians agree on steps to curb rising violence
description: Talks in Egypt stressed the need to prevent any disruptive actions at Jerusalem's holy sites during Ramadan.

title: Iraq and Iran sign deal to tighten border security
description: Iraqi officials say move is aimed at tightening frontier with Iraq's Kurdish region.

title: UBS to buy Credit Suisse for $3.24bn in government-brokered deal
description: Authorities had been scrambling to rescue Credit Suisse before financial markets reopened on Monday.

title: What is the legacy of the Iraq War?
description: The Iraq War has reshaped the country and impacted the region.

title: Lagos governor re-elected in win for Nigeria’s ruling party
description: All Progressive Congress's Babajide Sanwo-Olu led the voting with a clear margin over his closest rival.

title: Iran’s Raisi welcomes invitation from king to visit Saudi Arabia
description: Iranian president has received an invitation to visit Saudi Arabia following reconciliation deal, Iranian official says.

title: Israeli wounded in occupied West Bank shooting
description: Wounded Israeli and soldiers returned fire, wounding Palestinian gunman, who was arrested, Israeli army says.

title: Montenegro goes to the polls as president seeks re-election
description: If no presidential candidate secures more than 50 percent of votes, a second round of voting will take place next month.

title: Floods destroy homes of quake survivors in northwestern Syria
description: Torrential rains damage hundreds of shelters for families displaced by February 6 earthquakes in Syria.

title: Afghan women deserve a Nobel Peace Prize
description: Under the Taliban regime, Afghan women are facing growing hostility and restrictions, but they continue to resist.

title: Syria’s Assad in UAE for second post-quake Gulf visit
description: The trip – al-Assad's second to the oil-rich country in as many years – comes after a visit to Oman last month.

title: Rape as a weapon in the war on asylum seekers
description: Disturbing reports of sexual assault in the Darién Gap reveal yet another horrifying aspect of border warfare.

title: Kuwait court nullifies 2022 vote, reinstates previous parliament
description: Last year's polls saw opposition members clinch 28 out of 50 seats, giving them a parliamentary majority.

title: Qatar charges ex-finance minister with bribery, embezzlement
description: Al-Emadi will face a criminal trial following his 2021 arrest over embezzlement allegations.

title: How the US and UK tried to justify the invasion of Iraq
description: What were the reasons given for the Iraq war, and how do they stand up today?

title: Cyclone Freddy death toll in southeast Africa surpasses 500
description: World Meteorological Organization says Cyclone Freddy, which started in February, is likely the longest-ever.

title: Photos: The millions who protested against the invasion of Iraq
description: Anti-war protests swept across the world as millions demonstrated against the 2003 invasion of Iraq by US and allies.

title: Israeli, Palestinian Authority officials meet for talks in Egypt
description: Backed by the US and Jordan, the day-long meeting follows last month's talks in Jordan.

title: At least 19 killed in Bangladesh bus accident
description: Police say up to 25 people were injured after a bus smashed through a highway fence and plunged into a roadside ditch.

title: UBS’s potential takeover of Credit Suisse: What you need to know
description: Credit Suisse was caught in the turmoil spurred by the collapse of US lenders Silicon Valley Bank and Signature Bank.

title: Photos: Life in a cemetery after Turkey’s earthquakes
description: An undertaker and his family move to a graveyard after their apartment was damaged by quakes.

title: How Ukrainian-Russian couples are faring after a year of war
description: Partners caught on different sides of the yearlong conflict reflect on how it has affected their relationships.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 389
description: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters its 389th day, we take a look at the main developments.

title: Putin visits Russian-occupied Mariupol in Ukraine
description: Vladimir Putin, who flew to Mariupol by helicopter, drove around city and stopped to talk to residents, TASS reports.

title: N Korea fires ballistic missile towards sea, say S Korea, Japan
description: Launch comes days after North Korea test-fired a suspected ICBM into the Sea of Japan.

title: Ethiopia’s Tigray region nominates new interim leader: Report
description: TPLF names spokesperson Getachew Reda for presidency of an interim regional administration, party-run media reports.

title: Kosovo, Serbia agree on steps to implement EU normalisation plan
description: Tentative agreement follows marathon talks between Serbian, Kosovar leaders and EU officials in North Macedonia.
